capability.name: Central Cash Handling
capability.definition: Track cash inventory, project demand and allocate inventory across the branch/ATM network
capability.role: This service domain is responsible for tracking the available cash inventory held centrally and distributed/collected throughout the branch/ATM network and making allocation/redistribution requests to ensure adequate float is available at all locations and that excess cash at any location is transferred to central secure locations as appropriate. Also coordinating with other banks and central banks to ensure sufficient cash is on hand to support the branch network requirements
capability.example: The central cash management function reviews the current and projected available float at locations across the network to ensure adequate supply to meet projected demand

key_features.name: Cash inventory usage and availability tracking
key_features.description: Enables cash inventory usage and availability tracking to support track cash inventory, project demand and allocate inventory across the branch/atm network

key_features.name: Cash inventory requirements evaluation and planning
key_features.description: Enables cash inventory requirements evaluation and planning to support track cash inventory, project demand and allocate inventory across the branch/atm network

key_features.name: Cash float availability and allocation oversight
key_features.description: Enables cash float availability and allocation oversight to support track cash inventory, project demand and allocate inventory across the branch/atm network
